content.rendered:
What is a Flight Engineer?

Flight Engineers are members of an aircraft’s crew that oversee the systems within said aircraft. Their main task is to make sure that the plane is operating properly and to communicate and fix it when it is not. 

Where does a Flight Engineer work?

  • The military
  • Commercial airlines

How much does a Flight Engineer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Flight Engineer is $55,102.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Flight Engineers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing flight engineering jobs.

  • Aerospace engineering majors
  • General engineering majors
Search Flight Engineering job opportunities on Handshake.

Flight Engineers skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Flight Engineers succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Familiarity with devices within the aircraft
  • Leadership

What are some common questions about Flight Engineers?

Q: How to become a flight simulation engineer?

A: If you’re an aspiring flight simulation engineer, a great place to start is by declaring a major in aerospace engineering or similar. It would also be wise to take courses or intern with places that teach you computer and math skills so they may transfer over to the simulation aspect of the role.
